alert.note: Alert for Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 11 at 3:44PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Bay. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 242 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding due to heavy rain up to 5 inches in the warned area earlier today. Flooding is currently ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Springfield, Hiland Park, Tyndall Air Force Base, Parker, College Station, Brannonville, Bayou George, Cedar Grove, Bay Harbor, Dirego Park, Millville, Majette, Bayhead, Camp Flowers, Beacon Beach and Cairo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
